name: Alea Research
title: Infinifi Onchain Fractional Reserve Banking What You Need To Know
text:
Synopsis
InfiniFi is pioneering an onchain fractional reserve banking system that aims to provide higher yields and more transparency than traditional banking by leveraging DeFi protocols, with a novel approach to stablecoin deposits and yield generation.

Key Insights
- InfiniFi has raised $3M in funding, led by Electric Capital, to develop its onchain fractional reserve banking protocol
- The protocol offers stablecoin deposits with a default 13% APY, with options to earn higher yields by locking up funds
- Users can specify which DeFi protocols (Aave, Pendle, Ethena) they want their deposits allocated to based on risk tolerance
- The system creates an iUSD token and uses a stability pool to manage potential mass withdrawals, mimicking traditional banking liquidity management
- The protocol differentiates itself by providing transparency in fund allocation and returning fees typically kept by traditional banks
- InfiniFi recently exited stealth mode and is currently available via waitlist
